intro: Rapistrum rugosum var. glabrum, commonly known as the smooth rapeseed, is a variant of the wild mustard species native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a biennial or annual herb that typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm, featuring alternate, lance-shaped leaves with a rough texture. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in racemes, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Its fruits are short, cylindrical pods that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. This plant is often found in disturbed soils and is sometimes considered a weed in agricultural settings.
